title: Boots worthwhile?
body: Ok so since the enchantments for boots have been removed, they are now much less stat efficient and in many ways just take up an item slot, giving Cassiopeia and other such champs a huge advantage as her passive gives her free boots speed essentially without costing a valuable item slot, while those like hecarim are' left in the dust' as they can no longer get that extra bit of speed or utility. Are boots as essential as they once were, or will we start seeing more and more builds like those redmercy recently suggested as his builds which do not include them at all? Thoughts?

replies.body: at this point, knowing you cant get boot enchants, you can save between 300 to around 1000 gold towards your total final build by not ever buying them AND most likely being more COMBAT efficient having bought more useful items for damage+sustain, or, at least more combat efficient than you would be whether you kill/die or neither. its very nearly just total luck whether boots will suit you more than say, finishing a high value item, higher chance of finishing an item AND having enough for a pink ward/potion, maybe even the 125 gold items. having enough for an extra long sword/amp tome for 10AD/20AP, or even just being able to flatout buy a cloth armour, +15 armour, undoubtedly much more combat efficient than a luck based aspect of whether you'd be able to get away from an opponent that can kill you, or chase your opponent down to finish them off

approved- boots can be neglible in lane as smart play and picking your moment will still get you a kill, and its rare the boots alone are why you're dying. Getting hit in the fact by nukes or fighters is't going to change with the game the way it is, you dont want to push unsafely early and you should be aware enough of your flanks to have sufficient time to get away safely. I find t1 boots to be more a nice extra, i got a spare 280-320g.... meh i guess ill get my boots now and head back. 
 
only time i dont is if im within 100g of finishing any of my ghostblade stepping recipes, as.... with my champ picks, flash+boots is the only reason you'll get away, but then i got you for 5mins anyways and with the down time, i quickly farmed some boot cash anyways. 

I will say it's probably most important on Mid lane / Jg / ADC's purely as range vs range, boots can make the difference of a safe 1-2 hit without reply, jungle can never afford to be slow, middle may want tht slight extra speed to cast skill shots safely etc

Boots are still very important, if your enemy isn't building boots and you do, well that makes all the difference. Before the enchantments were removed I didn't buy them until late game even though I rushed boots of mobility, lucidity, berserker, and swiftness early on. 

Lets also not forget that boots also provide one of the few good items for magic penetration :P

This becomes even more true with the wind drake which gives % speed bonus.

Boots let you move faster. This means kiting potential, chase potential,  escape potential and better repositioning which make a huge difference in the actual game. You also get to lane faster on top of the really cost effective stats you gain on each kind of boots.

Rito stole fervor from Yasuo. Might as well remove boots from the game and just give weapons for classes with flat move speed stats

> Why is {{item:3153}} only 73.5% gold efficient rito, wtf

Because you can't calculate the gold efficiency of either its Active or Passive, which is where most of the gold combining cost goes toward. (That's plainly because 6% Current HP and 10% of Maximum HP is always gonna be relative to what you're aiming at.) Hence it would be more gold efficient when hitting a high HP target than a squishy.

approved- imo without going into freaky maths mode, even a quick instant calculation thats ball parked, BORK is almost required for any fighter/adc, it is an item that is always relevant and helps your sustain and grants a slow and another 10% hit...

So many champs scale better with this as their first item, especially with its attractive build path with item changes over the last few patches.

Just depends on your lane, how its pushed, being pushed, who you're vs, who you are, i dont find it compulsory to get boots early, i slip it in somewhere along my ghostblade build usually, but i dont really ever plan on when, just pick the right moment where i realize the extra movement will get me the kill, push me further and further up, also an early merc treads / zerker greaves etc can be the difference in damage, tenacity, cdr, mpen etc, even if not for the move speed, its still a handy item slot to fill, however since 6.9 i have had a number of games i hit full build by 30-35mins and i start swapping my boots and 1-2 items to counter the builds of the enemy. I always build my items according to the state of the game. Sometimes im back and i got a spare couple of hundred gold so i buy another boot piece, sometimes i just grab another long sword for the 3-512981y4 items i use that it builds into (long swords are never wasted on Xin Zhao)
